posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
Designing my meiee Ranger after Level 21 and trying to decide whether to give him 19 levels of WM or 10 levels of RDD (with attendant Bard levels).

RDD 10
Pros: +4 AB from Strength, Immunity to Fire/Paralysis/Sleep, +4 AC, Dragon Breath, + 8 to Saves vs. Spells, potential +8 AC from Tumble (if Bard), potential benefit from Bard/Curse Song, low level spells
Cons: Skill point investment in Lore, at least 1 level of RDD/Sorcerer, Wings

WM 19
Pros: +4 AB from Superior Weapon Focus and 3 Epic SWF.  Increased Multiplier, Ki Critical, 19 uses of Ki Damage.  
Cons: Skill point investment in Intimidate, must select Dodge, Expertise, Mobility, Spring Attack, Whirlwind Attack and Weapon Focus

Looking at it on paper for the first time, the argument for WM 19 seems weak - one should either take WM 7, or go all the way to 25 or 28, unless one is counting on the Ki Critical to get more Dev. Crits (though RDD would have a higher DC).

Thoughts?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Why not both?

Seriously a Bard 11/ Rdd 10/ Wm 19 is a very good build that gets the best of both worlds and finishes on a natural 48 AB easily.

For your actual question though, that concerns a Ranger and not a Bard, i would go with Rdd every time. Ranger 26 (28)/ Bard 4 (2)/ Rdd 10 is what you want in this case. The huge stat bonuses and more importantly the dragonic armour and fire immunity compined with the undispellable Ranger spells (freedom, cat's, e.t.c) will give you more power, leaving you room for more favored enemies as well. Bane of enemies plus huge strength and a 2-handed weapon will make you feel like a demigod in the field of battle while dragonic armour gives you back some of the armour that you lose for fighting without a sheild. Bard will also allow you to max out that sweet spellcraft for a nice plus 9/11 to all your saves Vs spells.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Fist, you said you were going for 19 WM levels.

That leaves you with only 5 FE's and that is on the low side, not to menton that you have to take BoE in a general feat level. Moreover you don't get full Tumble this way so you lose 4 AC amongst other things such as no UMD e.t.c

So, not really worth it if you ask my opinion, at least not with this level spread. I would recommend a Ranger 30/ Rogue-(Bard) 3/ WM 7 if you wanted to incorporate WM in your build. Your AB will be high anyway probably a net (47) and you will have all the benefits of the Rogue as well, such as full tumble skill, evasion, UMD, e.t.c

But, for all your effort the (Ranger/ Bard/ RDD) will still be a better option overall.
